page.title: 12CHANGES IN WORSBROUGH
page.content: {Mr Elmhirst}earned his living by becoming a lawyer. During World War 2 he became an ARP Warden. As he was walking through Worsbrough he was shocked at the{state of peoples houses and the way they lived. He decided to do something about this. He went into local politics and he became a councillor. Worsbrough Council then began a programme of house improvement.New council houses were built and many of the old back to back houses were pulled down. Mr Elmhirst became interested in {education}of the children of Worsbrough. He remembers his own school days at{Winchester}and was concerned that children in Worsbrough should have similar facilities in their own area. He became a{governor of several local schools to try to bring about improvement in education.
